page.title: 14Farming(2)
page.content: A contractor comes with his combine harvester to harvest our barley.This usually takes half a day. The combine puts the corn into large trailers and the straw and chaff are thrown back onto the ground. The straw is later baled to be used for anilmal bedding. Our barley is sent to Marsden's corn mill in Midge Hall where it is made into animal food. Our land is then ploughed and left to rest over winter. We also plant our potatoes in Spring. (Earlies in March, Main Crop in April.) After ploughing and cultivating the land chemical and manure fertilisers are applied. The soil is cut into rows with a special machine. A helicopter comes four times during the Summer to spray the potatoes to stop them getting blight and also to help produce a large crop.(Contd.)
